answers.answer: Diabetes, blood pressure, low fluid, baby under stress, your in labour for a while but not progressing, baby stops growing, your over due. Most drs won't do it without an actual medical reason
You can request to be induced on your due date, if the hospital is not busy. I hear it makes for a more painful labor.
I'm being induced on Tuesday for being over due. I was also induced w with my last one. It was actually an easy experience.

Reasons I was induced three times: overdue by a week, baby was getting too large, baby had gastroschisis and the surgical team had to be prepared. If you have a medical reason induction can be necessary, if not they most likely will not schedule one.
I think i will ask my doctor about being induced on my due date. Which is may 27th :)

Usually its a medical reason or you're over due. But my sister was recently indicted at 39 weeks even though she was scheduled at 40+1. She said she told her doctor she was ready to have the baby the doctor said okay Haha. All doctors are different I'll be asking my doctor if I can be induced the day after I'm due since my first was indicted I figure if this one doesn't come then it will have to be forced too
Normally induction is much more painful and closer contractions than natural labor. Your risk of a c section goes up with it also.

being induced is actually harder on the baby because the baby and your body can not work together since you are using artifical hormones to bring on labor. It increases chance or a c section, stress on the baby and in some cases infant death so make sure you look into the different types of drugs they can use to induce you and the side effects so you know what to ask for and what to refuse.

question: What are the reasons a doctor would want to induce you? I rather be induced then just sit and wait for my lil man to come on his own. Only because i can be more prepared if the date was set.
title: being induced?
